entries.meaning: The profile of a body of water flowing over an obstruction in a vertical drop.
(mathematics) Either of the two parts of a double cone.
(geology) A sheet-like mass of rock that has been folded over adjacent strata.
examples: The generation of an Alpine mountain range is a matter of piling on the nappes.

entries.meaning: (hydraulics) Geological nappe whose underside is not in contact with the overflow structure and is at ambient atmospheric pressure.
(cooking) The ability of a sauce or other relatively thick liquid to coat food, the back of a spoon, etc.

verbs.description: nappe (third-person singular simple present nappes, present participle napping, simple past and past participle napped)

examples: to nappe a leg of lamb with glaze
